New Records: England's victory in Australia on Sunday was the country's second tournament crown after its 2010 win.
England's second T20 crown after tasting success in 2010, joining the West Indies as the only two-time winners since the tournament's inception in 2007.
Key Match Events: England held Pakistan to 137-8 in front of a partisan 80,462 fans at a heaving Melbourne Cricket Ground.
In reply, England slumped to 49-3 in the sixth over as they struggled to get any momentum against a fiery pace attack.
Stokes's unbeaten 52 steered them to a five-wicket victory with six balls remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory added to the 50-over title England won in 2019, building on the legacy of former captain Eoin Morgan, who retired this year after transforming the team into a white-ball juggernaut.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The victory was England's second T20 crown after tasting success in 2010.
Others: The match was played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground in Melbourne, Australia.
